DataElement.preferredName: Radionuclide Imaging Agent Injection Site Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The code representing the anatomic site of the radionuclide imaging agent injection.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Procedure Agents Domain Radionuclide Imaging Agent Injection Site
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to agents used as part of a procedure._An imaging technique that uses a small dose of a radioactive chemical (isotope) called a tracer that can detect sites of cancer growth, trauma, infection or degenerative disorders. The tracer, which is either injected into a vein or swallowed, travels through the bloodstream to the target organ, and emits gamma rays, which are detected by a gamma camera and analyzed by a computer to form an image of the target organ._An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect._The anatomic site at which a medication or a vaccine is injected.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to agents used as part of a procedure.

Concepts.definition: A domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to agents used as part of a procedure.

Property.preferredDefinition: An imaging technique that uses a small dose of a radioactive chemical (isotope) called a tracer that can detect sites of cancer growth, trauma, infection or degenerative disorders. The tracer, which is either injected into a vein or swallowed, travels through the bloodstream to the target organ, and emits gamma rays, which are detected by a gamma camera and analyzed by a computer to form an image of the target organ.:An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.:The anatomic site at which a medication or a vaccine is injected.

Concepts.definition: An imaging technique that uses a small dose of a radioactive chemical (isotope) called a tracer that can detect sites of cancer growth, trauma, infection or degenerative disorders. The tracer, which is either injected into a vein or swallowed, travels through the bloodstream to the target organ, and emits gamma rays, which are detected by a gamma camera and analyzed by a computer to form an image of the target organ.
An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.
The anatomic site at which a medication or a vaccine is injected.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CDISC aligned NCI Standard CRF task. ghd

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representating the location of the body where a syringe and needle pushed fluids or drugs into the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: The area of the body located between the antebrachial and metacarpal regions.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
The area of the body located between the antebrachial and metacarpal regions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: A triangular space on the anterior side of the elbow joint. Three main veins of the arm, the brachial artery, the medial nerve and the tendon of the biceps pass through this space.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
A triangular space on the anterior side of the elbow joint. Three main veins of the arm, the brachial artery, the medial nerve and the tendon of the biceps pass through this space.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: A triangular space on the anterior side of the elbow joint. Three main veins of the arm, the brachial artery, the medial nerve and the tendon of the biceps pass through this space.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
A triangular space on the anterior side of the elbow joint. Three main veins of the arm, the brachial artery, the medial nerve and the tendon of the biceps pass through this space.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: The area of the body located between the antebrachial and metacarpal regions.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
The area of the body located between the antebrachial and metacarpal regions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: The terminal part of the lower extremity, especially the part below the ankle.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
The structure found below the ankle joint.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: The terminal part of the lower extremity, especially the part below the ankle.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
The structure found below the ankle joint.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Be specific about something; define clearly.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Associated concept to VM for TCGA. mc 11/9/12 - reversed concept order to match the semantics of this phrase which is "other" with "specify" as a qualifier/modifier - DW 12-30-2015

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Use of a syringe and needle to push fluids or drugs into the body; often called a "shot.":Named locations of, or within, the body.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Administration of a drug into a location within the body; this can be achieved either through an established access or via a needle.
Named locations of or within the body.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
ValueDomain.changeDescription:
7/7/17 jk VD released; transferred context and added CSI, registration status per Round 5 finalization task. 
 9/7/13 VD versioned to add VM concepts; proior version associated with CRF and Round 4 CRF data standard. jc   8/13/12 VD versioned to support max size change for VMs.  3/5/08 - released for UoWASH FES CRF.  10/3/07-created for ACRIN PET CDEs

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC Aligned NCI Standard Equivalent CDE
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is to be used for CDISC aligned data collection in place of CDE 2714760 from the original NCI Standard CRF Template.
